snippet: After the Asiana Boeing 777 crash, investigators are examining a dangerous practice in which the cockpit crew adjusts the plane’s position or controls while close to the ground.
abstract: Deborah A P Hersman, chairwoman of National Transportation Safety Board, says pilots of Asiana Boeing 777 that crashed in San Francisco told flight attendants to delay evacuating airplane while they communicated with the tower; safety board is using the crash of the plane, in which two passengers died, to learn all it can about what it calls 'survival factors.'
lead_paragraph: After the Asiana Boeing 777 crash, investigators are examining a dangerous practice in which the cockpit crew adjusts the plane’s position or controls while close to the ground.

headline.main: Pilots Delayed Evacuation to Talk to Tower, Official Says
headline.print_headline: Pilots Delayed Evacuation to Talk to Tower, Official Says
